name: TheAtlantic
text: "Requiring religious people in the ordinary course of their lives to follow the rules that apply to everyone else is not hostility; it is equality," Howard Gillman and Erwin Chemerinsky write: https://t.co/eaQ6mJyEg2

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As many New Yorkers have discovered since the start of the pandemic, our mayor has not demonstrated the ability to manage large-scale operations or the energy to get things done," @gracerauh writes: https://t.co/OF9OFtUv06

name: TheAtlantic
text: The fandom that embraced Ruth Bader Ginsburg reveled in playful kitsch. But, @megangarber writes, it was never frivolous. https://t.co/11CsZmLi8R

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Climate hell is here. We cannot stand it. And we cannot afford it either," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/Y7pf9gCf9L

name: TheAtlantic
text: Reports of a vote-by-mail apocalypse are greatly exaggerated: The nation's postal unions are considerably more confident USPS is ready for the election, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/mKWzV9MzUm

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The world starts to see you as a product...and that's a hard thing to deal with when you're a human." For The Friendship Files, @julieebeck spoke with Veronica Roth and @mstohl, authors of the "Divergent" and "Beautiful Creatures," about mental health: https://t.co/AVoObnD7St
